data.text:
@hkfp I guess

1. Taking panadol and isolated at home enough for mild symptoms

2. Home is a better place for rest than hospital/isolation facilities

3. Poor environment & management of hospital/isolation facilities, ie. Penny's Bay

4. Poor logistics after reported to the authorities
@hkfp Would love if this article also addressed any upside to when/how one discloses results... (other than complying with law—might one avoid forced isolation, for instance?)

@hkfp Who in their right mind would report it if they can cope with the symptoms and self isolate?

Govt is running around making up the rules as they go along. Who knows what authoritarian and unnecessary measure they will impose on you tomorrow that they're promising not to do today?
@hkfp 34,000 plus cases today why does it matter now? It’s impossible to get back to zero unless you lockdown all of HK for at least 1 month. Time to vaccinate and move on.
@hkfp I’m sure under the NSL the government would be able to force this information to be handed over …..

@hkfp Put it this way, healthcare system in HK has collapsed with this wave. HA and government had 2 years to build surge and did nothing. Infection control is not possible in hospitals and isolation in community centers mean inadequate care as you're all on your own. Can PM for more.
@hkfp Does somebody who's filled in the online form but don't really expect a timely response or any response at all count?
@hkfp Yr move will only get people into trouble! Please stop. How can u expect anyone in today's hk to entrust anyone! Wishful thinking
